questions.question: Casual Employment best matches which description

choices.answer: Someone who works as needed with no entitlements.
Person guaranteed set hours each week and full entitlements.
Person who works for themselves and makes all decisions.
Guaranteed minimum hrs each week and pro rata entitlements.

questions.question: Someone who works a few days per week and receives pro rata entitlements is best described as?

choices.answer: Casually Employed
Self Employed
Full time Employed
Part-time Employed

questions.question: An advantage of casual employment is:

choices.answer: Guaranteed hours
Paid sick days
HIgher rate of pay
Good credentials when applying for a loan

questions.question: Primary Industries can be described as the industry associated with:

choices.answer: Providing services to others
Growing or extracting natural resources
Anyone who works in a Primary school
Turning raw materials into finished or semi finished product

questions.question: The Labour force is:

choices.answer: All Adults able to work
Everyone between the ages of 16 and 67
All people who are employed
Those employed and those actively seeking work

questions.question: Examples of changing work patterns are:

choices.answer: All of the below
Higher participation rates of woman in the workplace
Reduced permanent and increased casual positions
Flexible workplace where tasks can often be done from home.

questions.question: Flexible working conditions could be described as:

choices.answer: The Boss can have you start and finish at any time they wish
You can choose when you take your holidays
You can choose how much and how long you work for each week
Can organise your set work hours to meet individual needs

questions.question: Skilled Jobs can be described as

choices.answer: Requiring few skills involving straightforward tasks
Requiring a small amount of training to perform tasks
Requiring specialised skills requiring high level training
None of the above

questions.question: Which statement is most true

choices.answer: Higher levels of education give higher levels of income
Education has no affect on a persons income
Uni qualifications ALWAYS pay more than apprenticeships
Education plays no part in finding a job

questions.question: 3 parts of a contract are:

choices.answer: Paper, pen and hand to sign
Offer, acceptance and performance
Offer, acceptance and consideration
Asking, offer and performance

questions.question: Consideration of a contract is:

choices.answer: Deciding whether to take the job or not
The agreement of duties in the exchange of money for labour
Accepting the contract offered
Asking for modifications to be made to a contract.

questions.question: An "Award" in contract terms is

choices.answer: A paper collected in front of people who congratulate you
Minimum working conditions
Guidelines of acceptable conditions
Conditions determined by an employer for an employee.

questions.question: A disadvantage of being under an award is

choices.answer: Ensures similar pay to others performing similar tasks
Protects employees from exploitation
No recognition of individual initiative
Sets standards which cannot be reduced

questions.question: Enterprise agreements

choices.answer: Cover everyone in a particular field
Contracts negotiated by an individual and the employer
Cover everyone in a particular company or business.

questions.question: A CEO of a company is usually under which type of contract?

choices.answer: Enterprise agreement
Common Law Contract
Award

questions.question: which statement is true

choices.answer: All employees have rights and entitlements
All employees have rights, but none have entitlements
All employees have rights, but casuals have no entitlements
Only permanent employees have rights and entitlements

questions.question: Cyclical unemployment is

choices.answer: Unemployment resulting from changes in seasons
People unemployed because they crashed while cycling
Unemployment resulting from skills not matching jobs
Unemployments resulting from changes in the business cycle

questions.question: Peoples skills not matching those available is an example of:

choices.answer: Cyclical unemployment
Seasonal unemployment
Structural Unemployment
Frictional unemployment

questions.question: To be unemployed you must satisfy which of the following

choices.answer: All of the below
Be actively looking for work
Have no job
Be able to start immediately

questions.question: The government aims for an unemployment rate of:
WHS stands for

choices.answer: World Health Standards
Wellbeing and Hope System
Where's His Suit?

questions.question: Which is an example of breaking the Sex Discrimination Act?

choices.answer: Dismissing someone because they have a sick child
Dismissing someone because they made unwelcome advances
Dismissing someone who spends too long in the bathroom

questions.question: Introducing rules that seem fair, but unjustly discriminates against a person is

choices.answer: Indirect Discrimination
Direct Discrimination

questions.question: Summary Dismissal is:

choices.answer: Firing someone who the business cannot afford to keep on .
Firing someone whop is not performing the duties expected
Firnig someone for serious breaches of contract

questions.question: If someone believes they have been unfairly dismissed they can apply to who?

choices.answer: Fair Work Ombudsman
The Australain Government
Police Station
Your local Solicitor

questions.question: It is Easy to achieve a fair balance between privacy and employer monitoring is easy

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What do trade unions do

choices.answer: Gather tradesman to have a big game of Rugby
Look after the interests of employees

Nothing as they are outdated and of no use

questions.question: Employer Associations

choices.answer: Represent workers
Are brainstorming groups to help businesses introduce items.

questions.question: The first level of dispute resolution is

choices.answer: Have a fight and the winner is right

questions.question: Arbitration is

questions.question: Collective wants are:

choices.answer: Things that most people want. Eg a Fararri
Essential items to live - food, water and shelter
Goods and services provided by the government for society
Groups of people who work together decide what they want.

questions.question: PAYG is:

choices.answer: Paying tax at the end of the financial year
